items.title: pip install fails on 3.8.1, prevents Jupyter install
items.body:
Facing the same issue for Python 3.8 32 Bit on Win 10

_Originally posted by @kikumar3189 in https://github.com/spyder-ide/pywinpty/issues/118#issuecomment-570467209_

milestone.title: v0.5.7
milestone.description: Minor release due to building errors

items.title: pip install fails on Python 3.8/Windoes
items.body: Please, add support to Python 3.8/Windows 64 bit. Situation is exactly the same as in issue #118.

items.title: Possibly of interest?
items.body:
In case you hadn't already seen:

https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/commandline/2018/08/02/windows-command-line-introducing-the-windows-pseudo-console-conpty/

Feel free to close as this isn't really an issue.

items.title: Python 3.7 wheels?
items.body: Any chance of providing wheels for Python 3.7?  Can I help?  I do a lot of package building...

items.title: Remove validation at import introduced in 0.5.2
items.body: Now that it we seems we have a real for the nasty access violation error, I think we can remove that expensive validation.

items.title: Disable ptyprocess blocking read by means of a environment variable
Access violation once again
items.body:
I'm getting 

```
Exception in thread Thread-10:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\Utilities\Development\Python\lib\threading.py", line 916, in _bootstrap_inner
    self.run()
  File "C:\Utilities\Development\Python\lib\threading.py", line 864, in run
    self._target(*self._args, **self._kwargs)
  File "C:\Utilities\Development\Python\lib\site-packages\winpty\ptyprocess.py", line 331, in _read_in_thread
    data = pty.read(4096, blocking=True)
  File "C:\Utilities\Development\Python\lib\site-packages\winpty\winpty_wrapper.py", line 74, in read
    ReadFile(self.conout_pipe, data, length, None, None)
OSError: exception: access violation writing 0x00000000

```
error whenever I'm trying to launch jupyter-notebook.

According to [this](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/14753939/unhandled-exception-at-0x76b1dd74-access-violation-writing-location-0x00000000) SO post the fourth parameter to ReadFile cannot be null.

Indeed, setting it to a valid pointer resolves the issue.

items.title: 0.5.2 wheels seem to be missing some DLLs
items.body:
See jupyterlab/jupyterlab#4642.

@andfoy, please install the Jupyter notebook or JupyterLab and verify that their consoles are working on Windows.

Fix CI Build
items.body: Use msys2/cygwin to compile pywinpty instead of MSVC on AppVeyor

items.title: from .cywinpty import Agent --> Error Python 3.6.4 and 2.7.x
items.body:
It is impossible to use the library due to this error:

> from .cywinpty import Agent
ImportError: DLL load failed: The specified procedure could not be found.

Executing
`python setup.py install`

I see this error but the procedure finishes without any problem:
`winpty/cywinpty.pyx: cannot find cimported module 'winpty._winpty'`

items.title: Python 3.6 doesn't support UR prefix
items.body:
The example in the main page is incorrect:
```
# Low level usage using the raw `PTY` object
from winpty import PTY

# Start a new winpty-agent process of size (cols, rows)
cols, rows = 80, 25
process = PTY(cols, rows)

# Spawn a new console process, e.g., CMD
process.spawn(ur'C:\windows\system32\cmd.exe')
```
because Python 3.6 doesn't support UR prefix. You have to pass it as a string:
`process.spawn('C:\windows\system32\cmd.exe')`

For Command Prompt if you use / instead of \ in the process.spawn() it doesn't work.

Is there a way to pass complicated command using PTY instead of PtyProcess?


Thanks

items.title: winpty.lib missing error
items.body:
Installing pywinpty with
`python setup.py install`

we receive this error:

> LINK : fatal error LNK1181: cannot open input file 'winpty.lib'

This is due to setup script that point to winpty.lib in
`C:\Python34\PCbuild`

You have to create that folder and put winpty.lib inside it if you want to complete the procedure. Complete linker command is:

`C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 10.0\VC\BIN\link.exe /DLL /nologo /INCREMENTAL:NO /LIBPATH:C:\Python34\libs /LIBPATH:C:\Python34\PCbuild winpty.lib /EXPORT:PyInit_cywinpty build\temp.win32-3.4\Release\winpty/cywinpty.obj /OUT:build\lib.win32-3.4\winpty\cywinpty.pyd /IMPLIB:build\temp.win32-3.4\Release\winpty\cywinpty.lib /MANIFESTFILE:build\temp.win32-3.4\Release\winpty\cywinpty.pyd.manifest`

Is this a bug?

items.title: OSError: [WinError 10048] on spawning of PtyProcess
items.body:
This is a follow up of #85. (Pywintypes 0.5.1, Win7, Python-3.6.4-64bit)

If a socket is already in use, an OSError is raised on Windows. However, [_get_address](https://github.com/spyder-ide/pywinpty/blob/master/winpty/ptyprocess.py#L352) increments the port number only for socket.error but not for OSError.

Changing the code to increment the port number on OSError solves the problem 99% of the time. However, sometimes another process acquires the port between _get_address (where the port is closed at the end) and the bind operation in [PtyProcess.__init__(...)](https://github.com/spyder-ide/pywinpty/blob/b5062b6673f94e140c88ea080d45fa810178ce7b/winpty/ptyprocess.py#L49). I think it is not a good idea to separate _get_adress from the actual bind in PtyProcess.__init__(...).

items.title: Release 0.5.1
items.body: I think 0.5.1 is ready. @andfoy, please do the honors of a releasing this version.

items.title: Update instructions to build from source for Python 2
items.body:
@blink1073, please update the instructions to build from source in our Readme for Python 2.7.

I mean, we need to show users that they need to setup the right env vars for setuptools to use MSVC 2013 instead of 2008.

items.title: Why is the tarball so huge?
items.body: Shouldn't the tarball only include source files?  We currently include built files and it is 48MB.

items.title: Python 2.7 Support?
items.body: Given @SylvainCorlay's comment [here](https://github.com/conda-forge/conda-forge.github.io/issues/460#issuecomment-343332639), I think we should resurrect https://github.com/spyder-ide/pywinpty/pull/66.  We are relying on `winpty` to handle the memory alloc/dealloc, and we are not passing OS primitives as described by @mingwandroid [here](https://github.com/conda-forge/conda-forge.github.io/issues/460#issuecomment-343320717).

items.title: Copy winpty binaries on Appveyor upload
Release 0.4.1
items.body: I forgot to add instructions to pack winpty binaries alongside binary wheels

items.title: Enable automatic wheel distribution using AppVeyor
Terminal server could not be located
items.body:
@jxrossel commented on [Wed Oct 04 2017](https://github.com/spyder-ide/spyder-terminal/issues/115)

## Description of your problem

When starting spyder, I get an error message with "Terminal server could not be located (...)" and something about starting spyder in debugging mode (which I don't know how to do).

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**

1. starting spyder
2.
3.

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
error message and no terminal in the consoles

**Please provide any additional information below**


## Versions and main components

* Terminal Version: 0.2.2
* Spyder Version: 3.2.3
* Python Version:  python-3.6.2.amd64 (from [WinPython](https://sourceforge.net/projects/winpython/files/WinPython_3.6/3.6.2.0/), then I just updated spyder and spyder-terminal)

@andfoy commented on [Wed Oct 04 2017](https://github.com/spyder-ide/spyder-terminal/issues/115#issuecomment-334277756)

Hi @jxrossel, to start Spyder on debugging mode you must need to set the ``SPYDER_DEV`` variable, as it follows, the following commands must be executed from a system terminal, which corresponds to ``cmd.exe`` on Windows:

```batch
set SPYDER_DEV=True
spyder
```
After the execution, the file ``spyder_terminal_err.log`` must appear on your current working directory, which is this case must be the directory of the current terminal. Please post the contents of this file, so we can help you to trace the error.

---

@jxrossel commented on [Thu Oct 05 2017](https://github.com/spyder-ide/spyder-terminal/issues/115#issuecomment-334395169)

Hi, when starting spyder like that, I first had another error message "The Jupyter Notebook server failed to start..." and then the same message as above. The error log doesn't seem very helpful:

```
2017-10-05 10:15:14 ETACH-W113024 __main__[8060] INFO Server is now at: 127.0.0.1:8071
2017-10-05 10:15:14 ETACH-W113024 __main__[8060] INFO Shell: C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe
```

I then tried to open a new terminal in spyder, and the error log became:

```
2017-10-05 10:18:05 ETACH-W113024 tornado.access[8060] INFO 200 GET /?path=C:/Users/rosselj/PythonDev/satemo (127.0.0.1) 4.00ms
2017-10-05 10:18:05 ETACH-W113024 tornado.access[8060] INFO 200 GET /static/css/ubuntu.css (127.0.0.1) 133.95ms

2017-10-05 10:18:05 ETACH-W113024 tornado.access[8060] INFO 200 GET /static/components/fetch/fetch.js (127.0.0.1) 6.00ms
2017-10-05 10:18:05 ETACH-W113024 tornado.access[8060] INFO 200 GET /static/components/xterm.js/dist/addons/attach/attach.js (127.0.0.1) 5.00ms
2017-10-05 10:18:05 ETACH-W113024 tornado.access[8060] INFO 200 GET /static/components/xterm.js/dist/addons/fit/fit.js (127.0.0.1) 5.00ms
2017-10-05 10:18:05 ETACH-W113024 tornado.access[8060] INFO 200 GET /static/components/xterm.js/dist/addons/fullscreen/fullscreen.js (127.0.0.1) 4.00ms

2017-10-05 10:18:05 ETACH-W113024 tornado.access[8060] INFO 200 GET /static/css/fonts/ubuntumono-regular-webfont.woff2 (127.0.0.1) 5.00ms
2017-10-05 10:18:05 ETACH-W113024 tornado.access[8060] INFO 200 GET /static/css/fonts/ubuntumono-bold-webfont.woff2 (127.0.0.1) 4.00ms
2017-10-05 10:18:05 ETACH-W113024 __main__[8060] INFO CWD: C:/Users/rosselj/PythonDev/satemo
2017-10-05 10:18:05 ETACH-W113024 __main__[8060] INFO Size: (56, 33)
2017-10-05 10:18:05 ETACH-W113024 tornado.access[8060] INFO 200 POST /api/terminals?cols=56&rows=33 (127.0.0.1) 105.96ms
2017-10-05 10:18:05 ETACH-W113024 tornado.access[8060] WARNING 404 GET /favicon.ico (127.0.0.1) 26.99ms
2017-10-05 10:18:05 ETACH-W113024 tornado.access[8060] INFO 101 GET /terminals/0f5853 (127.0.0.1) 0.00ms
2017-10-05 10:18:05 ETACH-W113024 __main__[8060] INFO WebSocket opened: 0f5853
2017-10-05 10:18:05 ETACH-W113024 __main__[8060] INFO TTY On!
2017-10-05 10:18:05 ETACH-W113024 tornado.access[8060] INFO 200 POST /api/terminals/0f5853/size?cols=67&rows=31 (127.0.0.1) 4.00ms
2017-10-05 10:18:05 ETACH-W113024 tornado.access[8060] INFO 200 POST /api/terminals/0f5853/size?cols=61&rows=31 (127.0.0.1) 3.00ms

```

The prompt in the terminal doesn't respond though


---

@andfoy commented on [Thu Oct 05 2017](https://github.com/spyder-ide/spyder-terminal/issues/115#issuecomment-334447775)

@jxrossel, can you open a browser tab on the server URL, as shown on the log file? On this case, 127.0.0.1:8071? Does a terminal appears there?

Also, I invite you to open an issue on spyder-notebook if you have notebook-related issues.

---

@jxrossel commented on [Thu Oct 05 2017](https://github.com/spyder-ide/spyder-terminal/issues/115#issuecomment-334448044)

Thanks for the answer, but pywinpty v0.2.1 is the last available version on pypi and its the one I have, so I can't update it...

I've stopped doing blind upgrades (with -U) since it tends to break installations (typically when upgrading a package which depends on the upgrade of another compiled package whose compilation fails...). Usually, I do a 2-step upgrade (with -U --no-deps first, then a simple install)

---

@jxrossel commented on [Thu Oct 05 2017](https://github.com/spyder-ide/spyder-terminal/issues/115#issuecomment-334449127)

... and I've checked the 127.0.0.1:8071 in my browser after opening Spyder. Nothing is shown on that page, but the tab title "OS Web terminal" is displayed (better than nothing, I guess!)

---

@andfoy commented on [Thu Oct 05 2017](https://github.com/spyder-ide/spyder-terminal/issues/115#issuecomment-334449354)

@jxrossel Is there any message on the developer Web console?

---

@jxrossel commented on [Thu Oct 05 2017](https://github.com/spyder-ide/spyder-terminal/issues/115#issuecomment-334450732)

```
SCRIPT445: Object doesn't support this action
File: main.js, Line: 11, Column: 1
var promptEvent = new Event('promptReady'); 
```

---

@andfoy commented on [Thu Oct 05 2017](https://github.com/spyder-ide/spyder-terminal/issues/115#issuecomment-334451910)

@jxrossel Can you test if pywinpty is working as expected? Please post the output of the following commands (From a Python prompt):

```python
from winpty import PTY

# Start a new winpty-agent process of size (cols, rows)
cols, rows = 80, 25
process = PTY(cols, rows)

# Spawn a new console process, e.g., CMD
process.spawn(r'C:\windows\system32\cmd.exe')

# Read console output (Unicode)
process.read()
```

---

@jxrossel commented on [Thu Oct 05 2017](https://github.com/spyder-ide/spyder-terminal/issues/115#issuecomment-334452922)

`process.spawn(r'C:\windows\system32\cmd.exe')
`--> True

```
process.read()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "C:\PortableSoftware\WinPython3-6\python-3.6.2.amd64\lib\site-packages\winpty\winpty_wrapper.py", line 55, in read
    None, None)
OSError: exception: access violation writing 0x0000000000000000
```

---

@andfoy commented on [Thu Oct 05 2017](https://github.com/spyder-ide/spyder-terminal/issues/115#issuecomment-334454057)

@jxrossel Finally an error! Let me check, it seems that this belongs to pywinpty rather than spyder-terminal. However, let me investigate more about it, this is the first instance of such issue.

---

@andfoy commented on [Thu Oct 05 2017](https://github.com/spyder-ide/spyder-terminal/issues/115#issuecomment-334454501)

Issue moved to [spyder-ide/pywinpty #59](https://github.com/spyder-ide/pywinpty/issues/59) via [**ZenHub**](https://www.zenhub.com/)

items.title: Access violation writing 0x0000000000000000 on Windows 7
items.body:
@jxrossel commented on [Wed Oct 04 2017](https://github.com/spyder-ide/spyder-terminal/issues/115)

## Description of your problem

When starting spyder, I get an error message with "Terminal server could not be located (...)" and something about starting spyder in debugging mode (which I don't know how to do).

**What steps will reproduce the problem?**

1. starting spyder
2.
3.

**What is the expected output? What do you see instead?**
error message and no terminal in the consoles

**Please provide any additional information below**


## Versions and main components

* Terminal Version: 0.2.2
* Spyder Version: 3.2.3
* Python Version:  python-3.6.2.amd64 (from [WinPython](https://sourceforge.net/projects/winpython/files/WinPython_3.6/3.6.2.0/), then I just updated spyder and spyder-terminal)
* Operating system: Windows 7

zict (0.1.2)
zope.interface (4.4.3)
</details>

---

@andfoy commented on [Wed Oct 04 2017](https://github.com/spyder-ide/spyder-terminal/issues/115#issuecomment-334277756)

Hi @jxrossel, to start Spyder on debugging mode you must need to set the ``SPYDER_DEV`` variable, as it follows, the following commands must be executed from a system terminal, which corresponds to ``cmd.exe`` on Windows:

```batch
set SPYDER_DEV=True
spyder
```
After the execution, the file ``spyder_terminal_err.log`` must appear on your current working directory, which is this case must be the directory of the current terminal. Please post the contents of this file, so we can help you to trace the error.

---

@andfoy commented on [Thu Oct 05 2017](https://github.com/spyder-ide/spyder-terminal/issues/115#issuecomment-334447775)

@jxrossel, can you open a browser tab on the server URL, as shown on the log file? On this case, 127.0.0.1:8071? Does a terminal appears there?

Also, I invite you to open an issue on spyder-notebook if you have notebook-related issues.

---

@jxrossel commented on [Thu Oct 05 2017](https://github.com/spyder-ide/spyder-terminal/issues/115#issuecomment-334448044)

Thanks for the answer, but pywinpty v0.2.1 is the last available version on pypi and its the one I have, so I can't update it...

I've stopped doing blind upgrades (with -U) since it tends to break installations (typically when upgrading a package which depends on the upgrade of another compiled package whose compilation fails...). Usually, I do a 2-step upgrade (with -U --no-deps first, then a simple install)

---

@jxrossel Can you test if pywinpty is working as expected? Please post the output of the following commands (From a Python prompt):

```python
from winpty import PTY

# Start a new winpty-agent process of size (cols, rows)
cols, rows = 80, 25
process = PTY(cols, rows)

# Spawn a new console process, e.g., CMD
process.spawn(r'C:\windows\system32\cmd.exe')

# Read console output (Unicode)
process.read()
```

items.title: Each call to isalive function cause to escape unwanted characters on output pipe
items.body: Instead of using ``WriteFile`` to check if the process is still open, we should use ``PeekNamedPipe`` to see if the pipe is alive.

items.title: isalive returns True if the underlying winpty process is dead, False otherwise
items.body: Return value should be True if the process is alive, False otherwise

items.title: remove  'pypiwin32' from setup requirements
items.body:
Mark Hammond did publish a wheel "pypiwin32" but:
- the package name (and sourceforge page) is "pywin32",
- cgohlke publish fresher wheels under "pywin32" name.

so to be able to keep cgohlke wheels, I whish you remove this line for the moment (when publishing wheels) (reverting https://github.com/spyder-ide/pywinpty/pull/49)

https://github.com/spyder-ide/pywinpty/blob/master/setup.py#L42

items.title: not finding "winpty.h" while recompiling v0.1.4
items.body:
message is:
`````
python setup.py sdist bdist_wheel
....
....
Writing pywinpty-0.1.4\setup.cfg
Creating tar archive
removing 'pywinpty-0.1.4' (and everything under it)
running bdist_wheel
running build
running build_py
running build_ext
building 'winpty.cywinpty' extension
C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 14.0\VC\BIN\cl.exe /c /nologo /Ox /W3 /GL /DNDEBUG /MD -IC:\WinPython\basedir36\buildSlim\winpython-32bit-3.6.x.0\python-3.6.2\include -IC:\WinPython\basedir36\buildSlim\winpython-32bit-3.6.x.0\python-3.6.2\include "-IC:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 14.0\VC\INCLUDE" "-IC:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10\include\10.0.10240.0\ucrt" "-IC:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\8.1\include\shared" "-IC:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\8.1\include\um" "-IC:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\8.1\include\winrt" /Tcwinpty/cywinpty.c /Fobuild\temp.win32-3.6\Release\winpty/cywinpty.obj
cywinpty.c
winpty/cywinpty.c(489): fatal error C1083: Cannot open include file: 'winpty.h': No such file or directory
error: command 'C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Microsoft Visual Studio 14.0\\VC\\BIN\\cl.exe' failed with exit status 2
````

items.title: Include pypiwin32 dependency using an env variable
Check if terminal dimensions are positive integers
Release 0.1.3
items.body:
After PR #44 I think we can release 0.1.3 to include `winpty` files inside our wheel.

@andfoy, please do that.

items.title: Bundle winpty binaries with Python wheels
items.body: After looking at [spyder#4753](https://github.com/spyder-ide/spyder/issues/4753), I realized that users that install pywinpty without conda might have some problems because they don't have the winpty.dll and winpty-agent.exe binaries on their path. Is it possible to distribute them inside the Wheel package? @ccordoba12

items.title: Get to know if a process is alive or not
add .txt to LICENSE to be windows friendly
Add LICENSE to Manifest.in
items.body: As suggested on conda-build specs and requested on [conda-forge/staged-reipces#3146](https://github.com/conda-forge/staged-recipes/pull/3146)

items.title: Change package name to be pywinpty
Update setup.py to discriminate between pywin32 and pypiwin32 dependencies
items.body: Package naming differences causes errors while package is being build using conda.

items.title: Remove experimental features
items.body: Asynchronous reading using ``LPOVERLAPPED_COMPLETION_ROUTINE`` callback signature causes compilation errors on x86 systems

items.title: On conda environments, compile using conda-build defined variables
Fix cursor and key sequence escapes
items.body: Enable xterm input escape sequences.
